byline.original: The Norfolk Argus, of Wednesday, says:From the Cincinnati Gazette, Aug. 7

headline.main: THE DOINGS OF THE PRIVATEERS.; MORE PRIZES RECAPTURED ARRIVAL OF THE SCHOONER MARY ALICE AT THIS PORT. ARRIVAL OF SCHOONER WM. S. TISDALE FROM FORT PICKENS. SHE IS CHASED BY A PRIVATEER. THE PIRATES. CAPTURE OF A SECESSION COLONEL.

docs.snippet: The letter of Gen. BUTLER to the Secretary of War, making inquiries as to the disposal of the numerous fugitive slaves now at Fortress Monroe and daily arriving there, has been responded to by Mr. CAMERON, and his reply was yesterday dispatched to...
docs.lead_paragraph: The letter of Gen. BUTLER to the Secretary of War, making inquiries as to the disposal of the numerous fugitive slaves now at Fortress Monroe and daily arriving there, has been responded to by Mr. CAMERON, and his reply was yesterday dispatched to Gen. BUTLER.

docs.snippet: DEAR WIFE: I wrote a letter to Capt. KIRKER a few days since acquainting him of my being in close confinement here, also Capt. MeIvor and Lieut. CONNOLLY, with about 37 other officers and 600 noncommissioned officers and privates from various...

headline.main: LETTER FROM COL. CORCORAN.; THE MANNER OF HIS CAPTURE BY THE REBELS.

docs.lead_paragraph: DEAR WIFE: I wrote a letter to Capt. KIRKER a few days since acquainting him of my being in close confinement here, also Capt. MeIvor and Lieut. CONNOLLY, with about 37 other officers and 600 noncommissioned officers and privates from various regiments, among whom are Sergeants MURPHY and DONOHUE and 35 privates of my regiment.

headline.main: GEN. WOOL.; The Troy Times, of Friday, Says:
SAFETY OF CAPT. DE GOLYER AND LIEUT. PRESTON.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: CIVIL WAR (THE WAR BETWEEN THE STATES)

docs.snippet: All through the North and West the first Volunteers for the war are now receiving their pay, and it comes not in money for the $11 a month would never have tempted the majority to such hard service but in the warm welcome and ovation of the people.
docs.lead_paragraph: All through the North and West the first Volunteers for the war are now receiving their pay, and it comes not in money for the $11 a month would never have tempted the majority to such hard service but in the warm welcome and ovation of the people.

headline.main: LETTER FROM FORTRESS MONROE; FURTHER PARTICULERS OF THE HAMPTON CONFLAGRATION CONDITION OF THE RIP RAPSANOTHER EXPEDITION, ETC.

docs.lead_paragraph: On opening the window on the west side of my room this morning, I beheld the town of Hampton in flames. It was not long after reveille. The smoke was rising in dense columns of black on the right, while the lighter columns told where the fire had been raging longer. It first broke out about midnight.

headline.main: COLONEL MILES' REPORT.; HEAD-QUARTERS FIFTH DIVISION,

docs.lead_paragraph: Capt. JAMES. B. FRY, Assistant Adjutant-General, Head-quarters Department: SIR My health being impaired, and growing worse, if I delay I shall not be able to report the operation of my division on the 21st inst., before Bull Run. Believing, besides, that commanders of brigades are directed to report to Head-quarters, I offer the following for the consideration of the General commanding:
